Scheduling_OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Scheduling_OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Scheduling_OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Scheduling_Period_Productivity_Data.description: The Scheduling Organization for the Scheduling Period Productivity Data.

Scheduling_Subgroup_OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Scheduling_Subgroup_OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Scheduling_Subgroup_OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Scheduling_Period_Productivity_Data.description: The Subgroup Organization for the Scheduling Period Productivity Data.
The Date & Time (millisecond precision) that the Scheduling Period Productivity Data starts.
The Date & Time (millisecond precision) that the Scheduling Period Productivity Data ends.
The expected sales forecast for this period.
The labor budget for this period.

When set to true, this flag will cause the input to be matched to existing Scheduling Period Productivity Data, thereby updating an existing instance if it exists. Matching is based on Scheduling Organization, Subgroup Org, and Start/End Dates.

description: Data related to the Scheduling Period Productivity Data(s) to be processed.

validation.validation: The Subgroup Organization field isn't valid for the scheduling organization. Configure allowed subgroup organizations for the scheduling organization. If subgroup organizations aren't allowed, leave the Subgroup Organization field blank.
Start Date and End Date are invalid for scheduling week as defined by the configuration for this organization.

The Scheduling Organization Reference isn't defined as a scheduling organization. Enter a different organization, or enable the organization as a scheduling organization in the Maintain Scheduling Organizations task.
The Scheduling Organization Reference isn't configured as of the Productivity Start Date.
The productivity data Start Date must come before the End Date.
